page.title: 19Local History in Horton.
page.content: There are several items of Local history in and around the village of Horton.The place name Horton is derived from the old English name "Horll" meaning mud which is likely to be associated with the nearby district of Kingswood.To the immediate east of our survey area there are two Hill Forts dating from the Iron Age. Although not in our square they are evidence of that early peoples settled in this area.The oldest house in Horton is in Kings Lane and dates from the 14th century.Many of the other houses in Horton and Little Sodbury were built during the 19th century, including the old manor house,Horton Hall.Little Sodbury is well known for the fact that William Tyndale lived there.He brought out his first New Testament in 1521.The chapel at Little Sodbury is named after him.
